title: Archaeologist Amarnath Ramakrishna transferred again
content: Ramakrishna was working as director Antiquity and National Mission on Monument and Antiquity, Delhi before the transfer

title: Lufthansa flight diversion due to 'bomb threat' upsets travel plans of Hyderabad-bound passengers
content: Lufthansa flight LH752 from Frankfurt to Hyderabad diverted back due to bomb threat, causing significant delays for passengers

title: Delhi-bound Indigo flight from Kochi makes emergency landing in Nagpur after bomb threat
content: Bomb threat received via Kochi airport’s official e-mail. The flight, which arrived in Kochi from Muscat, departed as a domestic flight to Delhi at 9.31 a.m.

title: Air India's Ahmedabad-London flight cancelled due to 'operational issues'
content: Flight AI-171, which crashed shortly after take-off from Ahmedabad on June 12, has been replaced with a new code AI-159

title: ED officials are evolving by expanding their powers day by day: Madras High Court
content: Justices M.S. Ramesh and V. Lakshminarayanan question ED’s authority to seal a residential/business premises if it happens to be locked when the officials go for a search and seizure operation

title: Amarnath yatra routes declared 'No Flying Zone'
content: The declaration issued by J&K Home Department on the orders of L-G Manoj Sinha said flying of any kind of aviation platforms and devices, including UAVs, drones, balloons, is prohibited from July 1 to August 10.

title: A rare behind-the-scenes look at artist Balan Nambiar’s home studio in Bengaluru
content: The Science Gallery recently organised a visit to artist Balan Nambiar’s home studio during which he explained his process and inspirations

title: India maintains nuclear edge over Pakistan with more warheads, next-gen 'canisterised' MIRV-capable missiles: SIPRI report
content: According to the SIPRI report, India’s new ‘canisterised’ missiles, which allow warheads to be pre-mounted and transported more safely, could potentially carry nuclear warheads even during “peacetime”

title: Screening of films cannot be threatened with arson, violence: Supreme Court
content: The petition filed against the film had sought action against elements who have issued threats and incited violence against theatres and the makers of the film

title: Ahmedabad plane crash: 135 victims identified, 101 bodies handed over to kin
content: According to doctors, the mortal remains of 101 deceased which have been handed over to their relatives belonged to different parts of Gujarat, Maharashtra, Bihar, Rajasthan and Diu

title: Watch: The hefty environmental cost of a shipwreck
content: On 25 May 2025, the Liberian cargo vessel MSC Elsa 3 sank off the coast of Kochi in Kerala. It was carrying 644 containers. By 28 May, three hundred kilometres to the south, flotsam started washing up on the shores of Kanniyakumari.

title: Karnataka CM counters BJP claim of lack of funds by launching development projects worth ₹1,350 crore in Davangere
content: Initiating various works, Chief Minister Siddaramaiah says that the projects are a response to BJP’s allegations that the government does not have funds

title: Israel-Iran conflict: Indian citizens using own vehicles advised to ‘move outside Tehran’
content: The Embassy of India advised, “All Indian nationals who are in Tehran and not in touch with the Embassy are requested to contact the Embassy of India in Tehran immediately and provide their location and contact numbers”

title: Kerala sex racket case: Two policemen arrested
content: Shaijith and Sanith, both drivers in the police force, were arraigned along with 10 others, including six women, in the case in which a suspected sex racket was busted in a rented facility at Malapparamba

title: Minister promises necessary funds for widening roads in Raichur district of Karnataka
content: PWD Minister Satish Jarkiholi said that development of an area depends on the condition of roads and good connectivity

title: Ahmedabad plane crash: Centre's probe panel to submit report in three months
content: The safety checks of 12 of them have been done and no issue has been found so far, the Minister of State for Civil Aviation, says Union Minister of State for Civil Aviation Murlidhar Mohol

title: Congress says open to alliance in U.P. but also focused on rebuilding its strength on ground
content: In the 2024 Lok Sabha elections, the Congress-Samajwadi Party alliance delivered a strong performance—the Congress winning six of the 17 seats it contested and the SP bagging 37 seats

title: Ahmedabad plane crash: ‘We grieve together,’ says U.K. Deputy PM Rayner at vigil for victims
content: At a multi-faith memorial service organised by India House in London on Monday (June 16, 2025), Ms. Rayner was joined by fellow parliamentarians, Foreign Office officials and members of the Indian community as they paid solemn tributes to the lives lost in the Ahmedabad plane crash.

title: Road connecting Belagavi-Bagalkot districts to be upgraded at a cost of ₹300 crore
content: The project is expected to boost trade, commerce and tourism, apart from helping residents of border villages seek healthcare in hospitals in neighbouring districts

title: Belagavi farmers tie buffalo in gram panchayat office complaining of exceptional delay in approval for animal sheds
content: Zilla Panchayat Chief Executive Officer Rahul Shinde said that he would tell a senior officer to look into the complaint

title: ‘The pot calling the kettle black’, says JD(U) leader Ashok Choudhary after Tejashwi accused NDA of ‘favoritism’
content: Bihar Minister Ashok Choudhary responded after RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav’s accused the ruling NDA government  of practicing “favoritism”

title: Agents who dupe poor with promises of a future abroad devalue Indian passport, says Supreme Court
content: The court made the remarks while hearing a case against an agent accused of tricking people off their money by promising them a career abroad

title: People scramble to flee Tehran; Iran's wartime chief of staff killed - 10 key developments
content: Tensions soar as Israel and Iran exchange missiles, prompting widespread evacuations and airspace closures across the Middle East. President Trump, after calling for the evacuation of Tehran, cut short his G7 appearance, signaling a hardline stance while paradoxically claiming Iran still seeks a nuclear deal. With civilian casualties rising and regional conflict escalating, the world watches anxiously.

title: 'Operational issues': Air India Ahmedabad-London flight cancelled - what we know
content: An Air India flight AI-159 from Ahmedabad to London Gatwick got cancelled. The flight was scheduled to depart at 1 PM. Passengers were not given a reason for the cancellation. This cancellation occurred after the Air India Flight AI171 crash on June 12. The earlier crash resulted in many fatalities. The reason for cancellation is aircraft availability issue.

title: No Kohli, no Rohit? Doesn't matter — Team India still a threat
content: India is gearing up for a five-Test series against England, commencing on June 20th at Headingley, Leeds. Despite the absence of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma, Graeme Swann believes India still possesses sufficient strength to challenge England. Jos Buttler anticipates Shubman Gill, the new Test captain, will blend the leadership styles of his predecessors while forging his own path.

title: Honeymoon murder: Video from Double Decker trek captures Raja's killers; one tries to hide face
content: A tourist's video footage has become a key piece of evidence in the Raja Raghuvanshi murder case. The video, recorded on May 23 in Meghalaya, shows Raja and his wife, Sonam, on the Double Decker trek, along with the three men accused of his murder. Police confirmed the accused were ahead of the couple on the trail

title: Middle East on edge: Trump abruptly leaves G7; is a US strike on Iran’s bomb-making facility coming?
content: President Trump abruptly left the G-7 summit amid escalating Middle East tensions, hinting at potential US involvement in an Israeli strike against Iran's nuclear program. This decision has sparked controversy, with some MAGA figures like Tucker Carlson and Marjorie Taylor Greene criticizing Trump for abandoning his "America First" policy and risking a wider conflict.

title: Boeing crisis: Elon Musk hints too many managers may be the issue
content: Following the Air India Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner crash in Ahmedabad, which killed 241 passengers and crew, safety concerns have risen. A resurfaced tweet from Elon Musk criticizing Boeing's management has added fuel to the fire. The DGCA has ordered enhanced safety inspections for Air India's Dreamliner fleet.

title: SC pulls up HC over Kamal Haasan’s film; says 'mob can't be allowed to take to streets'
content: The Supreme Court intervened in the 'Thug Life' film controversy, overturning the Karnataka High Court's demand for Kamal Haasan to apologize for his remarks on the Kannada language. The apex court has now taken over all proceedings related to the film, directing the Karnataka government to ensure its smooth release.

title: IPL: Buttler compares Wankhede's atmosphere to Taylor Swift's concert
content: Jos Buttler likened the electrifying Wankhede Stadium atmosphere during IPL matches to a Taylor Swift concert, citing deafening crowd noise, especially when facing Bumrah. He also praised Shubman Gill’s composed leadership and inner fire ahead of India’s Test series.

title: ‘Watch out … ’: China’s exports to US dip sharply; why India needs to be on the guard
content: Amidst trade tensions with the US, China has strategically shifted its export focus, increasing shipments to India, the EU, and ASEAN. While China's overall exports saw a moderate rise, exports to the US significantly declined, offset by growth in other markets.

title: Nothing CEO reacts to Trump’s smartphone launch; says ‘We’re cooked’
content: The Trump Organization has entered the mobile market with Trump Mobile, launching the T1 Phone, priced at $499. Unveiled by Donald Trump Jr. and Eric Trump, the Android 15 device boasts a 6.8-inch AMOLED display, 50MP camera, and 5000mAh battery. Targeting customers seeking American-made products, the T1 Phone aims to capture a share of the U.S.

title: 'I don't know how to play...': When Kohli's admission left Buttler stunned
content: Jos Buttler revealed how a candid chat with Virat Kohli during IPL 2023 helped him cope with pressure. Kohli's honest admission of self-doubt and advice on expectations gave Buttler new perspective on performance and mental resilience in elite cricket.

title: Kochi-Delhi IndiGo flight makes emergency landing in Nagpur after bomb threat
content: An IndiGo flight from Muscat to Delhi made an emergency landing in Nagpur. This happened after a bomb threat was reported. All passengers were safely taken off the plane. Security and bomb disposal teams are investigating. So far, nothing suspicious has been found. Authorities are checking the threat's source. The safety of everyone is the priority.

title: SSC GD Constable Result 2025 Soon: How to Download Scorecard, Key Info
content: The SSC is expected to release the SSC GD Constable Result 2025 by mid or late June on its official website, ssc.gov.in. The result, based on the CBT held from February 4 to 25, will list qualified candidates’ roll numbers along with cut-offs. Those shortlisted will proceed to PET, PST, medical examination, and document verification.

title: How China dodges the US chip ban: Flying suitcases, renting servers abroad, and ....
content: Chinese firms are devising ingenious methods to circumvent US AI chip restrictions, including processing data abroad. Recently, engineers transported hard drives filled with data to Malaysia, utilizing Nvidia's advanced chips in a local data center to train an AI model. Southeast Asia is becoming a hub for these activities, with data centers rapidly expanding.

title: Final goodbye: Father pays tribute to AI 171 pilot killed in Ahmedabad crash - video
content: Captain Sumeet Sabharwal's remains, a pilot in the Air India crash, arrived in Powai, Mumbai, amidst grieving family and friends. The June 12th crash near Ahmedabad claimed 241 lives, including crew and passengers, with DNA identification efforts underway. A London memorial service honored the victims, attended by dignitaries and diaspora members, while one survivor receives medical care.

title: Women's ODI rankings: Smriti Mandhana returns to top spot after five years; replaces Laura Wolvaardt
content: Indian cricket star Smriti Mandhana has reclaimed the top spot in the ICC Women's ODI Batting Rankings, surpassing Laura Wolvaardt. The South African batter's recent performance dip in the series against West Indies allowed Mandhana to regain her number one position with 727 rating points.

title: IND vs ENG: England won't want Jasprit Bumrah to play 5 Tests, says Broad
content: Stuart Broad has hailed Jasprit Bumrah as the best bowler in the world and a major threat in the upcoming England-India Test series. He praised Bumrah’s calm yet fierce competitiveness and dissected his unique bowling mechanics, warning that if fully fit, the Indian pacer could dominate the five-Test series.

title: Aruna Irani reveals she didn't have kids with Kuku Kohli as she was his second wife
content: Aruna Irani opened up about her marriage with Kuku Kohli and past relationship with Mehmood. She confessed to falling for Kohli, a married man, despite her prior experience. Irani revealed she chose not to have children, fearing they would face stigma as she did being born to a second wife.

title: Fake medical emergencies: Pilgrims hire ambulances as taxis to skip Kedarnath queue
content: In Sonprayag, police caught ambulances being misused. Pilgrims were using them to bypass the Kedarnath trek queue. The ambulances were stopped near the Acrow bridge. Drivers claimed ignorance about the scheme. They said they were only following instructions. Police issued challans and seized the vehicles. The incident highlights attempts to circumvent rules during the pilgrimage.

title: Red zone to rocket science: 120 Gadchiroli students fly to Isro
content: In a historic moment, 120 tribal students from Gadchiroli embarked on their first-ever airplane journey. Their destination was the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) headquarters in Bengaluru. Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis encouraged the students to dream big and pursue careers in science and technology. The initiative aimed to inspire scientific ambition among underprivileged children.

title: Carlsen fever! Harikrishna copies famous fist-smash of World No 1 - Watch
content: Magnus Carlsen’s emotional outburst after losing to Gukesh has gone viral. Indian GM Pentala Harikrishna hilariously mimicked the fist smash in a FIDE interview. Even Anish Giri joined the fun earlier, tapping his fist before a game with a smile.

title: Iran-Israel conflict: How will blocking of Strait of Hormuz hit India? Explained
content: Amid escalating Iran-Israel tensions, India is proactively exploring alternative energy sources, particularly from West Africa, to safeguard its fuel supply. Contingency plans are being formulated due to potential disruptions in the Strait of Hormuz, a critical global energy transit point. While India possesses significant storage capacity, concerns remain about potential price spikes and supply crunches affecting the global market.

title: Haryana model stabbed 8 times; boyfriend confesses to murder
content: Haryana model Sheetal Chaudhary, known as Simmi, was murdered by her boyfriend, Sunil, who stabbed her multiple times. Sheetal's body was found in a Sonipat canal after she made a distress video call to her sister, reporting Sunil's assault. Sunil confessed to the murder, citing possessiveness and suspicion as motives, and is now in police custody as investigations continue.

title: Teen dies from rapid bacterial infection:Symptoms and causes
content: A 14-year-old boy in South Carolina tragically died from meningococcemia, a rare and rapidly progressing blood infection. Doctors are emphasizing the importance of recognizing early symptoms, which resemble the flu, and seeking immediate medical attention. The infection spreads through close contact and can cause severe complications if not treated promptly with antibiotics.

title: No red beacon, no frills: Old video of former Gujarat CM Vijay Rupani resurfaces - watch
content: Former Gujarat Chief Minister Vijay Rupani passed away in a plane crash. He was known for his simple lifestyle. A video resurfaced showing Rupani removing the red beacon from his official car. This act symbolized his commitment to humility. The Gujarat government banned red beacons for VIP vehicles. Rupani also instructed police not to halt traffic for his convoy

title: Meghalaya honeymoon murder: Sonam declared mentally sound
content: Sonam Raghuvanshi, accused of murdering her husband Raja during their honeymoon in Sohra, underwent a mental health assessment and was deemed sound. Her brother has been summoned for questioning as the investigation continues. Authorities plan to recreate the crime scene with the five suspects, while Raja's family held a private 'tehrvi' ceremony, grappling with unanswered questions and demanding further investigation.

title: SSC CPO 2025 notification for Delhi police, CAPF SI postponed: Check details
content: Attention job seekers, Staff Selection Commission has deferred the Sub-Inspector exam notification. The exam is for Delhi Police and Central Armed Police Forces. The notification was scheduled for June 16, 2025. Commission officials cite administrative reasons for the delay. The revised date will be available on ssc.gov.in. The notification includes registration, exam dates, eligibility, vacancies, and fees.

title: IPL | Buttler on Vaibhav Suryavanshi: 'His bat swing is like Yuvraj and Lara'
content: Jos Buttler lauded 14-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi's incredible talent, drawing comparisons to Brian Lara and Yuvraj Singh after witnessing his explosive 35-ball century in the IPL. Buttler highlighted Suryavanshi's fearless approach and ability to dominate world-class bowlers like Siraj, Krishna, and Rashid Khan. He further praised the young batter's composed performance against Chennai, showcasing maturity beyond his age.

title: NIOS class 12 April 2025 result declared at results.nios.ac.in
content: The National Institute of Open Schooling (NIOS) has announced the Class 12 results for the April-May 2025 session on results.nios.ac.in. Students can now check their scores and download provisional mark sheets. The original documents can be collected from their respective study centers later. NIOS also provides options for marks verification, re-evaluation, and improvement exams.

title: Controversy avoided! R Ashwin, team cleared of ball-tampering allegations in TNPL
content: R Ashwin, the former Indian cricketer, has been cleared of ball-tampering allegations in the Tamil Nadu Premier League (TNPL). The Madurai franchise accused Ashwin's team, Dindigul Dragons, of using chemically treated towels to alter the ball's condition during their match.

title: Gold price prediction today: What will be the impact of Iran-Israel conflict?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are fluctuating due to the ongoing Iran-Israel conflict, initially surging before easing on de-escalation hopes. Despite Iran's willingness to negotiate, tensions remain high, influencing market sentiment. Investors are closely monitoring geopolitical developments, US economic data, and central bank decisions for further direction, with potential support and resistance levels identified.

title: Exclusive | 'Your main job is to perform... ': Ex-England captain on Gill
content: Former England captain Graham Gooch shares his insights ahead of the India-England Test series, emphasizing the honor of captaincy and the importance of Shubman Gill performing with the bat. Gooch believes England has a point to prove with their aggressive approach, while also acknowledging the home advantage.

title: Israel-Iran tensions: Indians asked to 'move to a safe location' outside Tehran
content: The Indian Embassy in Tehran has issued an urgent advisory, urging Indian nationals and Persons of Indian Origin (PIOs) residing in the Iranian capital to relocate to safer areas. Citing a worsening security situation, the embassy advises those who can leave Tehran using their own means to do so immediately.

title: IND vs ENG: ‘Want Bumrah and Stokes available...’ - Rob Key
content: "That’s why people turn on the TV," says Rob Key, Managing Director of the England men's cricket team, as he Talks to TOI on the upcoming five-test series, the changing attitudes of English cricket & why it’s imperative to create the perfect environment for players to deliver their best.

title: G7 summit: PM Modi arrives in Canada; what's on agenda, why his visit matters?
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is in Canada for the G7 Summit, marking his first visit in a decade. Discussions will center on energy security and technology. Invited by Canadian PM Mark Carney, this visit aims to improve strained relations following previous diplomatic tensions.  Ties between the two countries had worsened after the killing of pro-Khalistani separatist Hardeep Singh Nijjar in June 2023.

title: Haryana model murder case: Tattoos help ID body; last seen with boyfriend
content: Haryana model Sheetal, also known as Simmi Chaudhary, was found dead in a canal near Sonipat, bearing injuries from a sharp weapon. She had been missing since June 14 after leaving for a shoot. Her boyfriend, Sunil, was found in his car in a canal in Panipat and has been arrested. Police are investigating complaints Sheetal previously filed against Sunil.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 above 24,900; BSE Sensex opens on a choppy note
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, turned red in afternoon trade on Tuesday While Nifty50 went below 24,850, BSE Sensex was down over 300 points.

title: Technical snag in engine: Air India San Francisco-Mumbai flight halted in Kolkata
content: Air India flight AI180, traveling from San Francisco to Mumbai, experienced a technical malfunction in its left engine upon landing at Kolkata's Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose Airport at 12:45 am. The aircraft landed on schedule, but the engine snag delayed its onward journey. Passengers were asked to deplane around 5:20 am, with the captain citing flight safety as the reason.

title: 'Pushing us to nuclear brink': Netanyahu accuses Iran of pushing 'forever war'; watch video
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu accused Iran of pushing the Middle East towards a "forever war," warning of a looming nuclear conflict. He advocated for directly targeting Iranian leadership, including Supreme Leader Khamenei, to end hostilities. Netanyahu blamed Iran for regional instability, citing its alleged involvement in attacks and nuclear ambitions, urging international action to prevent a global threat.

title: IPL: 'What is this man telling Virat Kohli?'; Atherton roasts Karthik
content: Michael Atherton playfully questioned Dinesh Karthik about a lengthy timeout conversation with Virat Kohli during the IPL final. Atherton joked that Kohli's dismissal in the following over suggested Karthik's advice was ineffective. Karthik, struggling to recall the specifics, faced further ribbing from Nasser Hussain for his uncharacteristic silence on the matter.

title: 'Don’t need Sunjay Kapur’s money': Randhir Kapoor never approved Karisma’s marriage
content: Randhir Kapoor voiced his disapproval of Karisma Kapoor's marriage to Sunjay Kapur, emphasizing the Kapoor family's independence from Sunjay's wealth. The couple's 2003 marriage ended in a contentious 2016 divorce, with allegations of infidelity and financial disputes. Sunjay Kapur, who passed away in June 2025, amassed a $1.2 billion fortune through Sona Comstar.

title: India Post GDS 4th merit list 2025 released at indiapostgdsonline.gov.in:Check here
content: India Post has announced the 4th merit list for GDS Recruitment 2025 on its website, indiapostgdsonline.gov.in, listing candidates selected for various Gramin Dak Sevak posts based on their Class 10 marks. Shortlisted candidates must now prepare for document verification, ensuring they have all required original documents and photocopies ready for submission as per the notification from their Divisional Head/Post Office.

title: 'Immediately evacuate Tehran': Trump's big warning amid Iran-Israel conflict; to leave G7 summit early
content: US President Trump issued a stark warning to Tehran, urging immediate evacuation amid escalating tensions and potential nuclear concerns. This followed reports of an Israeli airstrike on Iran's state broadcaster and significant damage to a major uranium enrichment facility. While Iran seeks US intervention, Trump hints at a potential diplomatic deal post-G7 summit, diverging from other leaders' calls for de-escalation.

title: HISTORY! Netherlands edge Nepal after THREE Super Overs - watch video
content: In a historic cricket match in Glasgow, the Netherlands triumphed over Nepal after an unprecedented three Super Overs. The thrilling contest saw both teams matching each other throughout, with Nepal forcing the first Super Over with a late surge. Ultimately, the Netherlands secured the win thanks to Zach Lion-Cachet's decisive final Super Over performance and Michael Levitt's winning six.

title: Video: Israel Destroys Iran's 'Mock-up' F-14 Tomcats Jets
content: The dramatic video, shared by the Israel Defense Forces (IDF), shows the twin-engine fighter jets erupting in flames after being hit by Israeli drone strikes.

title: Students Jump From Building To Escape Burning Air India Plane After Crash
content: A new video has emerged showing students and staff jumping out of the medical college's building, where an Air India plane had crashed last week.

title: Woman Burns Son's Hands, Legs With Hot Iron Rod For Being 'Naughty', Arrested
content: According to police sources, the accused reportedly became furious with her child's behaviour and resorted to the brutal punishment.

title: In Rainy Cherrapunji, A Crucial Process In Honeymoon Murder Probe
content: The crime scene depicting the murder of Raja Raghuvanshi was recreated today in the picturesque East Khasi Hills of Meghalaya, this rainy morning.

title: NDTV Ground Report: J&K Tourist Spots Reopen 2 Months After Pahalgam Attack
content: NDTV visited the Betaab Valley - named after the film starring Sunny Deol and Amrita Singh which was shot there in the 1980s - and spoke to workers and tourists, who said they are happy that normalcy is being restored.

title: In Pics: Captain Sumeet Sabharwal's Last Rites, Grieving Family Bids Final Goodbye
content: The body of Captain Sumeet Sabharwal, pilot of the Air India plane which crashed in Ahmedabad last week, was brought to Mumbai on Tuesday for his last rites.

title: Israel-Iran Attacks LIVE: Iran's Wartime Chief Of Staff Killed In Israeli Attack On Tehran
content: Israel-Iran Attacks LIVE Updates:The deadly conflict between Iran and Israel entered its fifth day on Tuesday, with both sides widening their attacks.

title: Ali Shadmani, Iran's Top Commander And Khamenei's Close Aide, Killed In Israeli Strike
content: The Israeli military said Tuesday it killed Iran's top military commander, Ali Shadmani, in an overnight strike, calling him the closest figure to Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei.

title: After Honeymoon Murder, Meghalaya Bans Renting Private Vehicles For Commercial Use
content: A public notice issued by the Office of the Commissioner of Transport dated June 13, 2025, clarified that Meghalaya has not implemented the Rent-a-Motorcycle or Rent-a-Cab schemes.

title: College Student Gang-Raped By 10 At Odisha Beach, Male Friend Tied Up
content: 10 men have been arrested for the alleged gang-rape of a young woman near the Gopalpur beach in Odisha's Ganjam district.

title: Air India Crash: Boeing Top Official Meets Tata Sons Chairman
content: US aircraft major Boeing's Head of Commercial Airplanes Stephanie Pope met Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran during a visit to the Air India headquarters in Gurugram on Monday, a source said.

title: UP Man Killed A Day Before His Wedding, 1 Arrested: Police
content: A groom was murdered a day before his wedding in Uttar Pradesh's Rampur, police said. The incident took place on June 15 and police have taken into custody a man hailing from Dhanpura, the village of the groom.

title: Colonel's Teary Farewell In Uniform To Husband-Pilot Killed In Chopper Crash
content: Lieutenant Colonel (Retd) Rajveer Chauhan was killed with six others onboard as the chopper from the Kedarnath temple to Guptkashi in Uttarakhand crashed in a forest.

title: Who Was Sheetal Choudhary, Haryana Model Killed By Married Lover
content: Sheetal Choudhary, also known as Simi on social media, was a 26-year-old model and budding actress from Panipat, Haryana.

title: Video: 6-Foot Alligator Seen Walking With Man Outside US Motel
content: A 6-foot alligator was spotted casually strolling outside a motel room in Fairfax County, Virginia, leaving tourists panicked.

title: Opinion: Opinion | The IMF-Shaped Irony In Pakistan's Massive Defence Budget Hike
content: The Pakistani defence budget retains its opacity. Neither the International Monetary Fund (IMF) nor the Financial Action Task Force (FATF) has been able to persuade Pakistan to be a little more transparent to its own people.

title: At Captain Sabharwal's Final Farewell, A Grieving Father, Teary Hugs
content: Sumeet's 88-year-old father, visibly shattered, performed the prayer ritual, standing beside his son's coffin, barely able to speak.

title: Iranian Anchor Emerges Hero After Israeli Strikes, Her Gesture Goes Viral
content: Sahar Imani, one of the most prominent anchors with the Iranian state television, is being praised widely on social media for returning to broadcast immediately after an Israeli strike on the studio last evening.

title: What is the significance of the Shipki La pass? | Explained
content: Why was tourism and trade stopped at the Shipki La pass? What is the cultural and spiritual connection that binds people on both sides of the border? Did the Shipki La pass account for a great volume of bilateral trade between India and China? Will its reopening encourage religious tourism?

title: BJP MP Abhijit Gangopadhyay critically ill, hospitalised
content: Hospital officials say he is suffering from acute pancreatitis with gastrointestinal sepsis and is currently under close observation in the ICU; State president of the BJP Sukanta Majumdar visits ex-HC judge at the hospital

title: Karnataka anganwadi workers to lock centres, boycott work as part of mass protest on July 9
content: The Karnataka State Anganwadi Workers Association affiliated to centre of Indian trade Union (CITU) has decided to shut down the anganwadi centres and boycott work on July 9 as part of the mass protest organised by the anganwadi workers and helpers.

title: New Tatkal rules aimed at curbing bots and bulk train ticket bookings | Data
content: As 60% of Tatkal tickets are bought in the first 10 minutes of the booking window, the new system aims to give genuine users a fighting chance

title: Four suspected illegal Bangladeshi immigrants held in Pune
content: On verification, they were purportedly found to be Bangladeshi citizens named Swapan Mandal, Mithun Kumar, Ranodhir Mandal, and Dilip Mondal

title: Air India flight from San Francisco to Mumbai suffers technical snag; passengers deplaned in Kolkata
content: Flight AI180 arrived on time at 0045 hrs at the airport but the technical snag in the left engine resulted in the take off getting delayed.

title: PM Modi arrives in Canada for G7 Summit
content: Prime Minister Modi will also hold several bilateral meetings on the sidelines of the Summit, coming over a month after India's Operation Sindoor that had targeted terror infrastructure in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir in retaliation for the April 22 Pahalgam attacks.

title: Indians turning to Artificial Intelligence for news, influencers find big audience: report
content: The Reuters Institute for the Study of Journalism’s annual Digital News Report finds that Indians prefer video content for news, and rely on generative AI for summarising and personalising news

title: Minor landslides reported in Kasaragod; river breaches bank in Kannur
content: Torrential rain causes widespread disruption in Kasaragod and Kannur, prompting closures, landslides, and flood alerts in affected areas

title: Delhi-bound Air India flight returns to Hong Kong after snag
content: Air India flight AI 315 safely returns to Hong Kong due to technical issue, passengers assisted, aircraft under inspection

title: BJP MLAs walk out from West Bengal Assembly; one suspended, another cautioned
content: Manoj Oraon was suspended for the day for improper conduct during Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee’s address; the Speaker cautioned BJP Chief Whip Sankar Ghosh

title: BJP goverments targeting Bengalis; labelling them Bangladeshi for speaking their tongue: Mamata
content: The Chief Minister’s remarks came a day after three residents of West Bengal, working in Mumbai were allegedly forced into Bangladesh by the BSF

title: Amitabh Kant resigns as G-20 Sherpa, thanks PM Modi for the opportunities
content: The retired IAS officer had also served as NTI Aayog CEO, Secretary of the then Department of Industrial Policy and Promotion, and Joint Secretary at the Ministry of Tourism

title: Seeman shoots election salvo from palm tree; says govt. should remove ban on toddy
content: When we come to power, we will ban foreign liquor except in select places, says the NTK chief; Toddy is not banned in other States because their Chief Ministers are not connected to liquor manufacturers, he adds

title: T.N. Forest Department deputes mahouts and cavadies to Thailand for elephant care training
content: A team of 18 members will be deputed from June 17 to June 21; the delegation includes four mahouts, 11 cavadies, a forest range officer, and a forest veterinary assistant surgeon

title: A year after Kallakurichi hooch tragedy, the pain isn’t over for families
content: Though the grisly reminder of the tragedy that claimed 69 lives is fading in Karunapuram in Kallakurichi district, the pain isn’t over with survivors

title: IIT Madras Pravartak launches course in machine learning operations
content: The online 110-hour certification MLOps course, jointly offered with TCS iON, aims to prepare professionals for careers in AI, ML and to address the demand for talent in the evolving domain of machine learning operations

title: Domestic workers urge Union government to enact law for fair wages, social security
content: Tamil Nadu Domestic Workers Welfare Trust submitted a petition to the State govt. to extend the Sexual Harassment of Women at Workplace (Prevention, Prohibition and Redressal) Act to domestic workers, among other demands

title: Minibuses to serve more than 25,000 km of unserved areas in Tamil Nadu
content: Chief Minister M.K.Stalin launches New Comprehensive Mini Bus Service with extended permitted route lengths

title: Footpath along Taluk Office Road revamped with lights, fountains
content: The Highways Department beautified the 300-m-long stretch adjacent to its campus in Saidapet. It now has seating arrangements and grass beds

title: Classes at newly sanctioned Jawahar Navodaya Vidyalayas to commence from July 14
content: Seven JNVs coming up in Bhadradri Kothagudem, Jagtial, Mahabubnagar, Medchal-Malkajgiri, Nizamabad, Sangareddy and Suryapet districts

title: Government scheme helps boy from Virudhunagar get admission to NIT Rourkela
content: The boy was selected under the Naan Mudhalvan scheme, implemented by Virudhunagar district administration, and was provided with coaching and reading materials to clear JEE Mains

title: Telangana healthcare gets a bureaucratic boost; civil servants choose govt. hospitals for medical needs
content: Their choices are reshaping perceptions, showing that trust in the State’s healthcare system is no longer limited to the underprivileged, but shared by those who help shape public policy themselves

title: GHMC Commissioner issues detailed SoP for sealing of unauthorised premises
content: The standard operating procedure issued clarifies that only a higher authority than the sealing officer can unseal a property

title: SCR set to shrink in scope as South Coast Railway gains steam
content: Newly-carved zone likely to become operational in 3 months; gazette notification to be issued after revised detailed project report, currently under review by Railway Board, is submitted

title: Telangana Intermediate Supplementary results announced; about 1.23 lakh first-year students show improvement
content: A total of 4,13,880 students, for both general and vocational stream, appeared in the Supplementary exams conducted at 892 centres

title: SFI’s protest before Kerala Raj Bhavan over photos of RSS leaders
content: A section of protesters tried to run into the campus of the Governor’s official residence, but the police swiftly stopped them using force

title: DRDO, IIT-Delhi demonstrate free-space quantum secure communication over 1 km
content: Considered a major breakthrough in the field of cybersecurity, the use of quantum entanglement is being described as a landmark achievement in the new quantum era of secure communication

title: New flowering plant species discovered in Aravali hills landscape near Jaipur
content: The plant was first spotted by researcher Nishant Chauhan, a committee member of the Satpura Biodiversity Conservation Society, who noticed a unique Portulaca-like succulent growing from the rock crevice on the dry and rocky hill slopes near the historic Galtaji temple on the outskirts of Jaipur

title: India to export 150 locomotives to Africa worth over ₹3,000 crore
content: The 4,500-HP locomotives are equipped with air-conditioned driver’s compartment, regenerative braking, microprocessor-based controls, and modular architecture

title: Government sent the right message to world through Operation Sindoor, says Vice-President
content: People have to believe in nationalism and the political class must remain united on all national issues, Vice-President Jagdeep Dhankhar said at a programme held at Jipmer in Puducherry

title: India will never forgive Lalu Prasad for insulting Ambedkar, says Chouhan
content: Union Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan said that RJD chief Lalu Prasad has “insulted” B.R. Ambedkar; Ministers Arjun Ram Meghwal and Bhupender Yadav demanded an apology from Mr. Prasad

title: Advocates’ body issues statement against ED notice to senior advocate Arvind Datar
content: Even though the summons against Arvind Datar has since been withdrawn, the association said it registers its strong protest against the move

title: Day after chopper crash, Uttarakhand government to resume helicopter services from June 17
content: Uttarakhand Civil Aviation Development Authority CEO Sonika announces the resumption and adds that services will only run if the weather conditions will be favourable; Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) is going to keep a close watch on all shuttle services

title: India starts relocating citizens from Tehran to other parts of Iran, considers exit routes from Israel for Indian citizens
content: As conflict escalates, EAM Jaishankar speaks to counterparts in Armenia and UAE; Indian embassy in Tehran working with local Iranian authorities to shift Indian citizens in the capital and other places to safer locations; in Israel, where the airspace is closed completely, Indian embassy officials in Tel Aviv are guiding citizens who can move out towards the land borders with Jordan and Egypt

title: Congress ‘deceives’ OBCs, treats them only as vote bank, says BJP
content: The decision to conduct a fresh caste survey in Karnataka was driven by the motive of ‘electoral engineering’, says Union Minister Bhupender Yadav

title: RJD accuses ruling JD(U) of ‘nepotism’ in Supreme Court panel counsel appointment
content: Senior RJD MP Manoj Jha says Janata Dal (United) national working president Sanjay Kumar Jha’s two daughters were made Group A panel counsel of the Union government in the Supreme Court without any necessary experience

title: Ban on use of drones near Kochi airport
content: The district administration has banned the operation of microlight aircraft, aero models, paragliders, Unmanned Aircraft Systems, powered hang gliders, laser beams, and hot-air balloons within a five-kilometre radius of the airport

title: Congress MLAs’ PIL plea over Khajaguda land: HC directs them to submit representation afresh to government
content: Part of the construction was in the full tank level of the Khajaguda Lake, the petitioners told the Bench

title: UAE-based entrepreneur pledges ₹6 crore to families of medical students killed in Air India crash
content: Dr. Vayalil, founder and chairman of VPS Healthcare, a multinational healthcare group, described Manav, Aaryan, Rakesh, and Jaiprakash as “future frontline heroes”

title: Surgical Gastro dept. at Thiruvananthapuram MCH celebrates golden jubilee
content: Department of Surgical Gastroenterology is the very first department to be established in a medical college to deal exclusively with complex gastrointestinal (GI) conditions needing surgical treatment in the country

title: Stranded Kashmiri students being shifted out of Iran’s capital Tehran to safer areas, say parents
content: A J&K Students Association spokesperson says students of Tehran University of Medical Sciences, Islamic Azad University and Iran University of Medical Sciences were successfully relocated; an estimate suggested 600 students from Kashmir were shifted to safer locations in Qom

title: Four women killed, several injured in firecracker factory explosion in Amroha
content: Blast in Atrasi village brings down entire structure; U.P. CM directs officials to expedite relief efforts

title: Karnataka HC upholds acquittal of former French consulate staffer Pascal Mazurier from charge of raping minor daughter
content: His wife had questioned the correctness of the trial court’s April 19, 2017 verdict acquitting Mr. Mazurier

title: Karnataka students in Iran, B-PAC team in Israel, seek to return amid tensions
content: The team was scheduled to return on the 14th. However, following the tensions with Iran, Israel closed down its airports and moved fleets of their major airlines out of the country

title: Thunder laud effort of 'fearless' Williams in Game 5
content: Jalen Williams, a first-time All-Star in his third NBA season, rose to the occasion Monday night, powering the Thunder to a 120-109 win over the Pacers in Game 5 of the NBA Finals, an effort that helped give his club a 3-2 series lead.

title: Haliburton limited by calf: If I can walk, want to play
content: Pacers star Tyrese Haliburton was hampered by a sore right calf as Indiana dropped Game 5 at Oklahoma City on Monday night to fall behind 3-2 in the NBA Finals.

title: Ohtani hits 100 mph in brief Dodgers pitching debut
content: Shohei Ohtani made his Dodgers pitching debut at home Monday, giving up a run in his lone inning of work, then struck out in his first plate appearance as Los Angeles' DH, marking the first time he has pitched and hit in a game since Aug. 23, 2023.

title: Red Sox execs defend Devers deal, cite 'alignment'
content: A day after trading All-Star slugger Rafael Devers to the Giants, Red Sox president Sam Kennedy told reporters on Monday night that Devers' refusal to change positions made it untenable for him to remain with the team.

title: Arkansas' Wood throws 1st MCWS no-no since '60
content: Arkansas' Gage Wood pitched the third no-hitter in College World Series history and first in 65 years on Monday, striking out a record 19 Murray State batters in a 3-0 victory.

title: Source: Steelers extend S Elliott on 2-year deal
content: The Pittsburgh Steelers and safety DeShon Elliott have agreed to a two-year, $12.5 million extension with $9.21 million guaranteed.

title: LeBron says focus is getting knee healthy by camp
content: As he prepares to return for his 23rd NBA season, Lakers superstar LeBron James said his priority is getting his left knee healthy in time for training camp.

title: U.S. hockey names first 6 players for '26 Olympics
content: The U.S. named Matthew and Brady Tkachuk, Auston Matthews, Jack Eichel, Quinn Hughes and Charlie McAvoy as its first six players for the 2026 Olympics, avoiding goaltenders on the initial roster unveiled Monday.

title: 🏀 How Bane trade will impact NBA offseason
content: Sunday's shocking deal has ramifications far beyond Orlando and Memphis -- including the Kevin Durant trade saga.

title: Inside Gage Wood's MCWS masterpiece
content: No hits, 119 pitches and one historic performance. Gage Wood was electric in his no-hitter for Arkansas.

title: Panthers within one win of a Cup repeat: Grades for both teams, outlook for Game 6
content: Florida leads Edmonton 3-2 heading home for the next game. Here's how it happened, and what to watch for.

title: The 7 MLB execs under the most pressure at the trade deadline
content: With the deadline on July 31, here are the front offices that could make or break their futures this trade season.

title: Grading the blockbuster stunner that sent Rafael Devers to the Giants
content: The Red Sox stunned the baseball world Sunday, trading their $313.5 million All-Star to San Francisco.

title: How J.J. Spaun battled Oakmont, rain and bad breaks for a U.S. Open title
content: Oakmont was almost unplayable Sunday afternoon in the rain. But in the end, it was exactly what Spaun needed to become one of the unlikeliest U.S. Open champions.

title: How a bucket-list MCWS trip turned into reality for Arkansas' Bash Braddahs
content: For five months, the Aloys have been making noise in Arkansas. Now their talent and journey is on full display.

title: The Liberty won their first WNBA title last year; here's why they're even better now
content: Their perfect season ended Saturday, but the defending champs might be better than last year, with one notable weakness.

title: Liam Delap and Pedro Neto impress for Chelsea, but questions about Blues' forwards remain
content: Chelsea were ultimately too much for LAFC to handle in the teams' Club World Cup opener, but will they find similar success vs. stiffer competition?

title: Are Real Madrid ready to begin the Xabi Alonso era at the Club World Cup?
content: Xabi Alonso needs to hit the ground running at Real Madrid, with the Club World Cup starting just three weeks after he was hired as coach.

title: Sources: Utd hold talks with Frankfurt's Ekitike
content: Manchester United have held exploratory talks with representatives of Eintracht Frankfurt striker Hugo Ekitike, sources have told ESPN, as they widen their search for attacking reinforcements.

title: Boca fans take over Hard Rock in Benfica draw
content: Nicolás Otamendi headed in the equalizer in the 84th minute to deliver Benfica a 2-2 draw against Boca Juniors in the teams' opening match of the Club World Cup that featured three red cards Monday in Miami Gardens, Florida.

title: Chelsea beat LAFC at Club WC as Delap debuts
content: Pedro Neto and Enzo Fernández each scored goals to propel Chelsea to a 2-0 victory over LAFC in the Group D opener for each team in the Club World Cup in Atlanta on Monday afternoon.

title: Boca blasts referee's PK call in Benfica comeback
content: Benfica overcame a two-goal deficit to secure a 2-2 draw against Boca Juniors on Monday night in a heated Club World Cup match, a contest marked by a controversial penalty call in favor of the Portuguese team.

title: Socceroos using MLS to prepare for World Cup
content: A trio of Socceroos who call MLS home are confident the league's rising standards will bolster their hopes of being part of the 2026 FIFA World Cup.

title: Maresca told Palmer to take 'initiative' for Chelsea
content: Enzo Maresca said he has challenged Cole Palmer to be more creative and "take initiative" after the England playmaker claimed he was "sick of going backwards or sideways" during the Conference League final in May.

title: 'It's impossible': Hot temps worry CWC players
content: Players and coaches competing at the Club World Cup have expressed concerns about the hot and humid conditions during the tournament.

title: Source: Bale joins group eyeing Plymouth sale
content: Former Real Madrid winger and Wales international Gareth Bale is involved with a United States private equity company discussing a potential takeover at Plymouth Argyle, a source has told ESPN.

title: USMNT eases pressure with big win to open Gold Cup, but tougher tests ahead
content: Sunday's big win should relieve some pressure on a U.S. team that's been struggling for form and harmony of late. However, it's clear bigger tests are ahead at this Gold Cup and beyond.

title: MLB reveals uniforms for 2025 All-Star Game, Home Run Derby

title: Texas State, cryptic posts and the Pac-12's next move
content: Texas State looms as the favorite to join the Pac-12. Why could that happen? What would come next? And what about Memphis?

title: Don't be surprised if ... these 19 things happen in 2025

title: McLaren's Montreal miscues give F1 rivals hope for rest of 2025
